items.title: Inconsistent state triggered when removing and reinstalling visdom with unsaved environments
items.body:
**Bug Description**

Ill try to be as concise as I can, however at the time of writing, I've not been able to pinpoint the exact circumstances in which my problem occurs. Every now and then it happened that I had to reinstall visdom, either to update or when trying to meet  some version requirement.  It's something which only I only experienced twice.

This is a problem which manifests itself if multiple visdom environments are used, but not saved. The error is triggrered in 

https://github.com/facebookresearch/visdom/blob/7b1203a0aa43a72a6e3dc2271ddba41f9cc960ce/py/visdom/server.py#L1013-L1026

`eid` will be a string to an old environment which was not saved (not present in `$HOME/.visdom`) and when making a call to `handler.state[eid]['jsons']`, `eid` is not a key present in `handler.state`. `handler.state` appears to be populated with the contents of  `$HOME/.visdom`, but for some reason `args` has access to environments which existed before the removal and reinstallation of visdom, but since these environments were not saved to `$HOME/.visdom`, now the app is in an inconsistent state and throws errors because my prior environments are no longer part of my current `handler.state`.

**Reproduction Steps**
I can't currently replicate reliably yet.

**Expected behavior**

Avoid entering into this inconsistent state.

**Screenshots**
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

**Client logs:**
n.a.

For any issues, please include the server logs. These are printed directly to stdout on the machine running `visdom` (`python -m visdom.server`).

items.title: 'markersize' has no effect on visdom.line
items.body:
**Bug Description**
`markersize` has no effect on `visdom.line()` - it acts as if `markersize` is always None.

**Reproduction Steps**
```python
viz.line(Y=np.random.rand(10), opts=dict(markersize=20))
```

**Expected behavior**
A line that connects 10 points each of radius/diameter equals 20 (equivalent to matplotlib).

If it's expected behavior, please remove `markersize` from the list of available options of visdom.line.

items.title: Latex support
items.body:
Will visdom support latex?

Currently, the command

```python
viz.line(Y=np.random.rand(10), opts=dict(title=r"$\alpha \sim \beta$"))
```

fails to render latex.

items.title: Not able to add another Y axis in line plot
items.body:
Hello @JackUrb ,
I have got another issue.
Here is the code that I am trying.
```
import visdom
import numpy as np
import json
from win32api import GetSystemMetrics
import time
# viz = visdom.Visdom()
viz = None
def Init_Visualization():
    global viz
    try:
        viz = visdom.Visdom()
        viz.delete_env("testing")
        viz.env = "testing"
        return True
    except Exception as e:
        print(str(e))
        return False
    
def Clear_Graphs():
    global viz
    data = viz.get_window_data()
    if len(data) >0:
        for i in json.loads(data):
            viz.close(i)
    # driver = webdriver.Chrome()

def VizPlot(plt):   
    global viz
    viz.matplot(plt,opts=dict(resizable=True),win="plot")
def Draw_Lines(X,Y1,Y2,title="nothing",win="nothing",total =3):
    global viz
    viz.line(
    X=X,
    Y=Y1,
    win=win,
    name='0',
    opts=dict(
    title=title,
    legend=["orig","pred"],
    width = (GetSystemMetrics(0)/total)-50,
    height=300,
    )
    )
    viz.line(
    X=X,
    Y=Y2,
    win=win,
    name="pred",
    update="append"
    )
    time.sleep(3)

    global viz
    viz.text("Train RMSE: {}   Test RMSE: {}".format(train_error,test_error),win="Error Correction",opts={'width':GetSystemMetrics(0),'height':10})

    viz.line(X=None,Y=None,win=win,name="pred",update="remove")
    viz.line(

    Y=Y,
    win=win,
```

items.title: Weird behavior changes of my program when initializing visdom
items.body:
So, I'm unsure if this is an issue with visdom or just some weird bug that I've stumbled upon.

I have a class which trains a pytorch and a bunch of other bits and pieces in my code, including a custom datasource.

This model works perfectly fine, including if I `import visdom`.

However, once I create a client instance via adding `self.vis = visdom.Visdom()` to the initialization, I get a weird error:

```
    input_size = len(from_data_ds[0][0])
KeyError: 0
```

The `from_data_ds` is a custom pytroch Dataset object... I'm not putting it here because I'd be too long... but it's weird that creating a visdom client (and that's all I'm doing, not sending that, not anything else) would result in an error in a completely unrelated class.

Are there any known issues where visdom overrides varios pytorch specific features or otherwises change the global behavior of python programs ?

items.title: Matplotlib resizable

labels.name: Fix Proposed
labels.description: There is a proposed fix for this issue that just needs to be acted on.

labels.name: help wanted
labels.description: For issues that welcome community support

items.body:
**Bug Description**
When calling `visdom.matplot()` with the `resizable` option set to True, I obtain the following error:
```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/Users/veniat/src/visdom/example/demo.py", line 562, in <module>
    Visdom().matplot(plt, opts={'resizable': True})
  File "/Users/veniat/src/visdom/py/visdom/__init__.py", line 1028, in matplot
    opts['height'] = 1.4 * int(math.ceil(float(height)))
ValueError: could not convert string to float: '345.6pt'
```
It seems that when the `resizable` flag is True, the string returned by bs4 for the height and width attributes will be in the format `"123.4pt"` rather than the expected `"123.4"`. 
I tried with matplotlib 3.0 and 3.1 and the error happens in both cases.

**Reproduction Steps**
Add the `opts={'resizable': True}` attribute to [matplot call](https://github.com/facebookresearch/visdom/blob/1cb8c19cb9fb86b3930ab06ce6d19837fba81244/example/demo.py#L57) in demo.py

One simple solution would be to add something like 
``` python      
if height and height.endswith('pt'):
    height = height[:-2]
```
After getting the `width` and `height` attributes with bs4, keeping the current behaviour if the string is in the expected fomat.

import plotly.offline as py
import plotly.graph_objs as go
fig = go.Figure(
        data=[go.Bar(x=[1, 2, 3], y=[1, 3, 2])],
        layout=dict(title=dict(text="A Bar Chart"))

you will get the following error:
The visdom experienced an exception while running: TypeError("plotlyplot() missing 1 required positional argument: 'figure'")

**Expected behavior**

I really need a working solution in the next days! Thanks for helping me.

items.title: replay_log not logging correctly
items.body:
**Bug Description**
`replay_log` function logs empty plots for a certain type of plots (line plot with updates tested here).

**Reproduction Steps**
With the following script:
```
import os
import numpy as np
import visdom

class Plotter(object):
    def __init__(self, env_name="main", host=None, port=8097, log_file=None, offline=False):
        if not host:
            host = 'localhost'
        print("connecting to host: " + host + ':' + str(port))
        if log_file is None:
            log_file = os.path.join(os.getcwd(), 'plots', env_name)
        self.vis = visdom.Visdom(log_to_filename=log_file,
                                 offline=offline,
                                 server='http://' + host, port=port)

        self.env_name = env_name
        self.plots = {}

    def plot(self, var_name, x, y, title_name="Default Plot",
             ymin=None, ymax=None, xmin=None, xmax=None, name="default"):
        if var_name not in self.plots:
            self.plots[var_name] = self.vis.line(X=x, Y=y, env=self.env_name, name=name,
                opts=dict(
                    title=title_name,
                    xlabel='training_steps',
                    ylabel=var_name,
                    xtickmin=xmin,
                    xtickmax=xmax,
                    ytickmin=ymin,
                    ytickmax=ymax
            ))
        else:
            self.vis.line(X=x, Y=y,
                          env=self.env_name, win=self.plots[var_name],
                          update='append', name=name)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    test_offline = True
    log_file = os.path.join(os.getcwd(), 'test2')
    if test_offline:
        plotter = Plotter(port=8098, offline=True, log_file=log_file)
        plotter.plot('test', np.array([0]), np.array([0]), title_name='test')
        plotter.plot('test', np.array([1]), np.array([1]), title_name='test')
        plotter.plot('test', np.array([2]), np.array([2]), title_name='test')
        plotter.plot('test', np.array([3]), np.array([3]), title_name='test')
    else:
        vis = visdom.Visdom(port=8098)
        vis.replay_log(log_file)
```

1. Run the above script with `test_offline = True`
2. Start visdom server on specified port (8098 used here)
3. Run the above script again with `test_offline = False`
4. See empty plots

**Expected behavior**
Expected `replay_log` to reproduce original logs.

**Screenshots**

items.title: Browser does not load all line plots in Python
items.body:
**Bug Description**
Will set windows via vis.line() multiple times, but only a fraction (e.g. 3-7 out of 8) plots will appear in the browser. Rerunning will result in variable number of plots showing up (e.g. 6, then 3, then 7, then 6).

**Reproduction Steps**
Enter steps to reproduce the behavior:
Repeatedly create plot windows via vis.line() multiple times in script.

**Expected behavior**
One plot for each window created.

**Screenshots**
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

What happens occasionally:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10430633/55854557-0b25d800-5b33-11e9-9664-c27f2d455adc.png)

Expected:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10430633/55893276-f0c91a00-5b85-11e9-8b55-5dbe666cfee4.png)

**Additional context**
Visualization Code
```import visdom

from datetime import datetime

class Visualizations:
    def __init__(self, env_name=None):
        if env_name is None:
            env_name = str(datetime.now().strftime('%d-%m %Hh%M'))
        
        self.env_name = env_name
        self.vis = visdom.Visdom(env=self.env_name)
        self.train_acc_win = None
        self.val_acc_win = None
        self.train_prec_win = None
        self.val_prec_win = None
        self.train_recall_win = None
        self.val_recall_win = None
        self.train_loss_win = None
        self.val_loss_win = None

    def plot_vis_line(self, value, step, win, xlabel, ylabel, title):
        return self.vis.line(
            [value],
            [step],
            win=win,
            update='append' if win else None,
            opts=dict(
                xlabel=xlabel,
                ylabel=ylabel,
                title=title
            )
        )

    def plot_train_acc(self, acc, epoch):
        self.train_acc_win = self.plot_vis_line(
            acc,
            epoch,
            self.train_acc_win,
            'Epoch',
            'Accuracy',
            'Train Accuracy'
        )
    
    def plot_val_acc(self, acc, epoch):
        self.val_acc_win = self.plot_vis_line(
            acc,
            epoch,
            self.val_acc_win,
            'Epoch',
            'Accuracy',
            'Val Accuracy'
        )

    def plot_train_prec(self, prec, epoch):
        self.train_prec_win = self.plot_vis_line(
            prec,
            epoch,
            self.train_prec_win,
            'Epoch',
            'Precision',
            'Train Precision'
        )
    
    def plot_val_prec(self, prec, epoch):
        self.val_prec_win = self.plot_vis_line(
            prec,
            epoch,
            self.val_prec_win,
            'Epoch',
            'Precision',
            'Val Precision'
        )

    def plot_train_recall(self, recall, epoch):
        self.train_recall_win = self.plot_vis_line(
            recall,
            epoch,
            self.train_recall_win,
            'Epoch',
            'Recall',
            'Train Recall'
        )
    
    def plot_val_recall(self, recall, epoch):
        self.val_recall_win = self.plot_vis_line(
            recall,
            epoch,
            self.val_recall_win,
            'Epoch',
            'Recall',
            'Val Recall'
        )

    def plot_train_loss(self, loss, epoch):
        self.train_loss_win = self.plot_vis_line(
            loss,
            epoch,
            self.train_loss_win,
            'Epoch',
            'Loss',
            'Train Loss'
        )
    
    def plot_val_loss(self, loss, epoch):
        self.val_loss_win = self.plot_vis_line(
            loss,
            epoch,
            self.val_loss_win,
            'Epoch',
            'Loss',
            'Val Loss'
        )
```
Called with
```
vis = Visualizations()
vis.plot_train_acc(metrics['accuracy'], trainer.state.epoch)
vis.plot_train_prec(metrics['precision'].item(), trainer.state.epoch)
vis.plot_train_recall(metrics['recall'].item(), trainer.state.epoch)
vis.plot_train_loss(metrics['loss'], trainer.state.epoch)
vis.plot_val_acc(metrics['accuracy'], trainer.state.epoch)
vis.plot_val_prec(metrics['precision'].item(), trainer.state.epoch)
vis.plot_val_recall(metrics['recall'].item(), trainer.state.epoch)
vis.plot_val_loss(metrics['loss'], trainer.state.epoch)
```

This feature would be useful for monitoring multiple training programs: each training has its own env with losses and visualizations and etc., while all the training can be monitored through the same env.

I tried to use `vis.get_window_data` to collect data from different windows and problems occurs during redrawing them. The data format collected seems to be not consistent with the format needed by `vis._send`.

I could write the data obtained from `vis.get_window_data` to a new environment json file located on `~/.visdom/xxx.json`, then start a new Visdom session. It seems a bit complicated. Is there more elegant way to do so?

And I could not find a way to refresh the current session to make it load the modified jason file.

items.title: Use scoped logger

labels.name: help wanted
labels.description: For issues that welcome community support

items.body:
**Bug Description**  
Some packages I use have custom log-handlers (pretty printing log messages).
However, because Visdom uses the Root logger, it enables a default handler for that logger and thus all messages from those packages get printed twice.

This behaviour was not happening before today, but I havent been using visdom in a couple weeks, so not sure when it changed.

**Reproduction Steps**  
1. Use a package/file that has a custom logging handler.
2. import visdom and create a Visdom object (aka generate a log message from visdom)
3. log something with the logger of that package/file and see it printed twice.

**Expected behavior**  
Use a dedicated 'visdom' logger in your codebase.  
I'm pretty sure that is the problem, as I could see a handler in the root logger was being created after running visdom code, but I might be mistaken.  
Anyway, this is how the logging mechanism was intended to be used imo...
Using the root logger is never a good idea as it influences every single logger from all packages used!  
A stupid example is if you set the logging level on the root logger, every logger will be affected (unless you reset them specifically afterwards, which is what I think you are currently doing with Tornado :clown_face:)


**Example fix code** (in case you never worked with custom loggers)  

setting up the logger (in init or dedicated file)
```python
import logging

log = logging.getLogger('visdom')
log.setLevel(...)
log.addHandler(...)   # Only if you want custom handler, otherwise default is used
```

using logger in any file
```python
log = logging.getLogger(__name__)
# This will create a logger based on filename (eg. 'visdom.server') 
# and thus all loggers in your package will automatically inherit from the 'visdom' logger 
# and have the same behaviour and settings

# alternative
log = logging.getLogger('visdom')
# Now all your logging messages get formatted as comming from visdom
# The solution above however allows to see which file generated the (error) msg -> easier debugging
```

You can probably read the documentation on the logging module if my explanation is unclear :innocent:

---

To anyone having the same problem (which I doubt, as there are not many packages creating custom logging handlers), a temporary quickfix.  
After running something from visdom that uses the root logger (eg. visdom.Visdom()), run the following snippet:
```python
import logging
logging.handlers = []  # <- deleting the root logger handlers 
# if you have eg. a filehandler to write all log messages to a file,
# you would not want to delete that one of course!
```

The issue with `readme` variale in `setup.py`

Hi, I have some trouble to find the way showing the name of pane. If you have more than one plots in same kind, such two histograms plot to show the distribution of train/valid datasets, it is inconvenient to distinguish each other without the name of pane. 

Thanks.

items.title: After running python -m visdom.server,some scripts can't download
items.body:
After running python -m visdom.server
It shows:
Downloading scripts. It might take a while.
ERROR:root:Error 404 while downloading https://unpkg.com/layout-bin-packer@1.4.0
It's Alive!

And after it done, it seem working well,but after i enter the localhost:8888,
i found it has warning:
WARNING:tornado.access:404 GET /static/fonts/layout_bin_packer (::1) 0.64ms
i has tried to uninstall the package,and delete file in sitepackge root,then using porxy to download it
but just fail.

i wanna ask if i can download this file from other site,or can you guys can give me some sugession to solve this problem.

items.title: Visdom will raise Proxy Error if a network proxy is used
items.body:
Visdom version:  0.1.8.5. 
The netork of my compture is obtained by another computer via a network Proxy (i.e, I added two command `export http_proxy="http://IP:port"` and `export https_proxy="https://IP:port"` in my `.bashrc`;
1. With this Poxy,  when run code contains visdom will raise an proxy related error in the below:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25881545/50165455-00df9400-0320-11e9-9220-7a66875656cb.png)
2. when cancelling the proxy by removing the two commands, visdom will works.
3. I think this is maybe related to the issuses #515  and #518 .
4. So, how could I use Visdom compatiblly with a network Proxy ? Thank you in advance!

items.title: [bug] Hostname fails to parse in initialization if it has trailing /

labels.name: help wanted
labels.description: For issues that welcome community support

items.body:
Trying to connect to my visdom server now returns this error client side:

```
ERROR:visdom:Handshake status 200 OK
```

On the server side, I get:

```
ERROR:tornado.application:Uncaught exception POST /:<PORT>/env/main (<IP>)
HTTPServerRequest(protocol='http', host=<IP>, method='POST', uri='/:<PORT>/env/main', version='HTTP/1.1', remote_ip=<IP>)
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/devonh/.local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/tornado/web.py", line 1590, in _execute
    result = method(*self.path_args, **self.path_kwargs)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/visdom/server.py", line 1086, in post
    username = json_obj["username"]
KeyError: u'username'
ERROR:root:ERROR: 500: {'exc_info': (<type 'exceptions.KeyError'>, KeyError(u'username',), <traceback object at 0x7fa292433488>)}
```

visdom on client and server side are both installed via:

```
pip install git+https://github.com/facebookresearch/visdom.git --user --upgrade
```
So version is visdom-0.1.8.5

I tried upgrading tornado as well, but it's up to date: tornado-5.1.1

items.title: Chrome Image Resize
items.body:
**Bug Description**
Under Chrome when resizing the image with scrolling the scaling is quite harsh, it somehow either makes the image quite big or very small (~ 1/8 of the size)

**Reproduction Steps**
1. Open visdom with image pane in chrome
2. Ctrl + Scroll on image


**Expected behavior**
Smoother resizing of an image (with factor ~0.8 or so instead of ~0.1)

items.title: How to resize/change scale of plotly plot
items.body:
My plot looks like this:
https://i.snag.gy/sjzNfF.jpg

It's really hard to see the curve in the early stages when the axis scale is like this. Tensorboard has a button that fits the plot, does visdom have a similar UI tool?

Click or dragging just moves the image around.
